response_text:
<![CDATA[CBC | Canada News ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/canada/?cmp=rss en-ca Thu, 12 May 2016 22:59:01 EDT CBC.ca http://www.cbc.ca/rss/image/cbc_144.gif http://www.cbc.ca/news/?cmp=rss <![CDATA[Canadians not racist but aboriginal issue 'invisible' to many, says Paul Martin]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/aboriginal/canadians-not-racist-but-aboriginal-issue-invisible-to-many-says-paul-martin-1.3579731?cmp=rss 1.3579731 Thu, 12 May 2016 19:52:38 EDT Kristy Kirkup News/Aboriginal

Racism isn't the culprit, but that doesn't change the fact that the challenges faced by Canada's Aboriginal Peoples have long remained out of sight and mind to many, says former Liberal prime minister Paul Martin.

]]> <![CDATA[Sophie Grégoire-Trudeau's call for more staff draws some harsh remarks]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/sophie-gregoire-trudeau-overwhelmed-1.3580164?cmp=rss 1.3580164 Thu, 12 May 2016 20:45:51 EDT Peter Zimonjic News/Politics

Sophie Grégoire-Trudeau’s claim that she's overwhelmed and needs more staff to cope with the mountain of requests for her time has ignited a debate about the role of the prime minister’s wife.

]]> <![CDATA[Liberals follow Tory lead in stalling sanctions over killing of Russian whistleblower]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/liberals-foot-drag-russia-1.3579347?cmp=rss 1.3579347 Thu, 12 May 2016 21:21:30 EDT Terry Milewski News/Politics

For six years, Bill Browder has campaigned for sanctions on Russian officials who allegedly engineered a massive theft and the murder of Browder's Moscow lawyer. The U.S. said yes to Browder. The EU agreed. The Canadians — whether Liberal or Conservative — keep promising, but don't deliver.

]]> <![CDATA[Ghomeshi now has tough task of trying to rehabilitate his image]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/jian-ghomeshi-image-career-1.3577364?cmp=rss 1.3577364 Thu, 12 May 2016 11:00:00 EDT Mark Gollom News/Canada/Toronto

With Jian Ghomeshi's sexual assault charges behind him, the former CBC Radio host now faces the challenge of trying to re-establish his career and rehabilitate an image damaged by those allegations.

]]> <![CDATA[Smich can't remember where he buried gun he believed to be Bosma murder weapon]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/hamilton/news/tim-bosma-trial-mark-smich-says-he-can-t-remember-where-he-buried-gun-1.3578641?cmp=rss 1.3578641 Thu, 12 May 2016 07:49:00 EDT Adam Carter News/Canada/Hamilton/News

Accused killer Mark Smich says he can’t remember where he buried a gun that he believes was used to kill Hamilton man Tim Bosma.

]]> <![CDATA[RCMP pleads not guilty to 4 labour code charges in Moncton Mountie shootings]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/new-brunswick/rcmp-labour-code-pleas-1.3576893?cmp=rss 1.3576893 Thu, 12 May 2016 05:00:00 EDT Alan White,Bobbi-Jean MacKinnon News/Canada/New Brunswick

The RCMP has pleaded not guilty on charges the force violated four health and safety provisions of the Canada Labour Code in connection with the 2014 Mountie shootings in Moncton, N.B., that left three officers dead and two others wounded.

]]> <![CDATA[Reunited and it feels so good: Some Fort McMurray evacuees in Edmonton back with their pets]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/edmonton/fort-mcmurray-wildfire-pets-owners-1.3578307?cmp=rss 1.3578307 Wed, 11 May 2016 22:22:40 EDT CBC News News/Canada/Edmonton

Some Fort McMurray residents have been reunited with their pets in Edmonton, after the Alberta SPCA and other organizations rescued hundreds of animals from the wildfire that led to mass evacuations.

]]> <![CDATA[As climate change claims heat up, insurance industry says we need to adapt: Don Pittis]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/fort-mac-climate-insurance-1.3576918?cmp=rss 1.3576918 Thu, 12 May 2016 05:00:00 EDT Don Pittis News/Business

More than 40 years ago, the insurance industry was a leader in warning about the impact of climate change. But as the number of weather-related disasters soars, experts say the business must focus on adapting to climate change, rather than preventing it.

]]> <![CDATA[Travis Vader trial: Defence witnesses cast doubt on Crown's murder timeline]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/edmonton/witnesses-testify-seeing-mccanns-day-after-they-were-allegedly-murdered-1.3580378?cmp=rss 1.3580378 Thu, 12 May 2016 22:59:01 EDT Janice Johnston News/Canada/Edmonton

For almost six years, the public has been led to believe Lyle and Marie McCann were last seen alive on July 3, 2010, but the defence on Thursday tried to blow holes in that theory with surprising witness testimony.

]]> <![CDATA[Partisan interests difficult to avoid in electoral reform debate]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/grenier-electoral-reform-politics-1.3577086?cmp=rss 1.3577086 Thu, 12 May 2016 05:00:00 EDT Éric Grenier News/Politics

Maryam Monsef, minister of democratic institutions, hopes MPs will be able to put political interests aside as they debate changing the way Canadians vote. That seems unlikely, as the electoral impact of reform will be hard to ignore for MPs — including those Liberals dominating the committee studying the issue.

]]> <![CDATA[Portrait of a PM who ruled from the cheap seats: Neil Macdonald]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/paul-martin-portrait-neil-macdonald-1.3578724?cmp=rss 1.3578724 Thu, 12 May 2016 11:42:17 EDT Neil Macdonald News/Politics

As the portrait of former prime minister Paul Martin goes up on Parliament Hill, Neil Macdonald recalls a politician who was decent and honest and worked harder than just about everybody else.

]]> <![CDATA[Bill Morneau jokes about sleeping with politician's daughter at Quebec speech]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/bill-morneau-jokes-quebec-1.3580376?cmp=rss 1.3580376 Thu, 12 May 2016 22:14:35 EDT The Canadian Press News/Canada/Montreal

Bill Morneau told Quebec business leaders on Thursday he's always appreciated the province's open and friendly climate — but this time Canada's finance minister wasn't talking about investment.

]]> <![CDATA[$81 a month, no strings attached, buys a healthier baby]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/health/healthy-baby-prenatal-income-benefit-1.3578029?cmp=rss 1.3578029 Thu, 12 May 2016 05:00:12 EDT CBC News News/Health

When pregnant women were trusted with $81 a month in prenatal benefits, no strings attached, their babies’ physical health did better, say Manitoba researchers. They would like similar income supplements to be offered across Canada.

]]> <![CDATA[Why the Crown and Ghomeshi's defence team could call their deal a win]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/jian-ghomeshi-win-deal-1.3577813?cmp=rss 1.3577813 Thu, 12 May 2016 05:00:00 EDT Laura Fraser News/Canada/Toronto

One of the most high-profile sexual assault cases in recent Canadian history came to a quiet close in Toronto Wednesday, as the Crown and Jian Ghomeshi's defence team negotiated a deal that several legal experts called a victory for both sides.

]]> <![CDATA[6 big problems with cancelling or delaying Muskrat Falls]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador/problems-with-delaying-muskrat-falls-1.3577276?cmp=rss 1.3577276 Thu, 12 May 2016 05:10:22 EDT Peter Cowan News/Canada/NL

A confidential briefing note obtained by CBC News lays out some serious problems and no benefits from postponing or cancelling the massive Muskrat Falls hydroelectric project.

]]>
